div.class: pp-podcast has-header header-hidden has-featured playerview media-audio

img.alt: The Mill River Podcast: School is in Session. Right?

div.div: The Mill River Podcast: School is in Session. Right?
Connecting Mill River Schools educators with each other and the broader community, during Coronavirus and beyond.

div.p: Episode 4 brings us Principal Jodie Stewart-Ruck and Board Member John McKenna speaking about our efforts to ensure equity in education. Focusing on our ongoing equity work, the dynamics emerging due to COVID-19, and the very certain needs that we can anticipate existing in a very uncertain future, Jodie and John bring quality experience, passion and leadership to this discussion. We hope you find it to be informative.

div.p:
All students feel respected, cared for, and loved.
Educators feel valued, respected and supported.
Students, educators and families work together to build
positive relationships.
Students know why they are learning.
Students know what they are expected to learn.
All learners have voice and choice in their pursuit of personal growth.
Students and educators have ongoing, rigorous opportunities to learn.
Educators believe in and model learning as a lifelong process.
Educators communicate with families before, during, and after challenges and successes.
The entire community benefits from the strengths of its students, staff and schools.
